text: Hey, does anyone have any experience with video editing on Linux? What is the best tools for that? Also, anyone attempted to use a green screen with Linux software as well? Thanks!

elements.text: Hey, does anyone have any experience with video editing on Linux? What is the best tools for that? Also, anyone attempted to use a green screen with Linux software as well? Thanks!

text: Kanden live and openshot are the 2 main ones. They aren't great, but they're ok

elements.text: Kanden live and openshot are the 2 main ones. They aren't great, but they're ok

text:
> Also, anyone attempted to use a green screen with Linux software as well?
OBS runs on Linux and can handle green screens quite well

elements.text: Also, anyone attempted to use a green screen with Linux software as well?
OBS runs on Linux and can handle green screens quite well

text: I think there is also shotcut.

elements.text: I think there is also shotcut.

text: I have heard good things about Lightworks. <https://www.lwks.com/> I think there is a free version.

attachments.title: Lightworks: The professional editor for everyone
attachments.fallback: Lightworks: The professional editor for everyone

elements.text: I have heard good things about Lightworks.
I think there is a free version.

text: I've used Kdenlive for basic stuff, I taught my first yr calc with it online this semester.

elements.text: I've used Kdenlive for basic stuff, I taught my first yr calc with it online this semester.

text: I think Davinci resolve has more features but it isn't open source

elements.text: I think Davinci resolve has more features but it isn't open source

text: I've found that shotcut is pretty good, it's a bit more versatile than openshot.

elements.text: I've found that shotcut is pretty good, it's a bit more versatile than openshot.
